data.question: What is the highest ethane uptake capacity reported for a MOF at approximately 1 bar and around room temperature?
Which MOF has shown the highest ethane uptake capacity among those studied, and what is its composition?
data.answer: Mg2V-bdc-tpt has shown the highest ethane uptake capacity among those studied, with a composition of C42 H24 Mg2 N6 O13 V.

data.question: How does the ethane uptake capacity of Mg2V-bdc-tpt compare to that of PCN-250?
data.answer: The ethane uptake capacity of Mg2V-bdc-tpt (166.8 cm³/g) is higher than that of PCN-250 (116.7 cm³/g).

data.question: What is the selectivity for C2H6/C2H4 separation achieved by Co2V-bdc-tpt, and how does it compare to its ethane uptake capacity?
data.answer: Co2V-bdc-tpt achieved a selectivity of 1.75 for C2H6/C2H4 separation, with an ethane uptake capacity of 159.6 cm³/g.

data.question: Which MOF among those studied has the lowest ethane uptake capacity, and what is its value?
data.answer: Co2V-ndc-tpt has the lowest ethane uptake capacity among those studied, with a value of 90.2 cm³/g.

data.question: Is the ethane uptake capacity of Mg2Ti-bdc-tppy higher than 150 cm³/g?
data.answer: Yes, the ethane uptake capacity of Mg2Ti-bdc-tppy is higher than 150 cm³/g, specifically 160.6 cm³/g.

data.question: Does the MOF Mg2V-dmbdc-tpt have a higher ethane uptake capacity than Co2V-ndc-tpt?
data.answer: No, Mg2V-dmbdc-tpt does not have a higher ethane uptake capacity than Co2V-ndc-tpt.

data.question: What is the role of the pore-partitioning agent in the synthesis of the MOFs studied?
data.answer: The pore-partitioning agent in the synthesis of the MOFs studied is used to partition the pore space, deactivate all open-metal sites (OMS), and contribute to the ethane-selective C2H4/C2H6 separation.

data.question: Can the MOF Co2Ti-bdc-tpt be considered robust in terms of thermal stability?
data.answer: Yes, Co2Ti-bdc-tpt can be considered robust in terms of thermal stability as it is thermally stable up to 450 °C.

data.question: What is the significance of the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) values reported for the MOFs in terms of adsorbent regeneration?
data.answer: The significance of the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) values reported for the MOFs in terms of adsorbent regeneration is that lower Qst values indicate advantageous adsorbent regeneration due to reduced energy consumption.
